result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Guzman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Guzman was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>50g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second/Subsequent Drug Offense], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court orders restitution set at $0. 
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
- As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program  after serving 4 YEARS of initial confinement.
***07/19/2016 - Judge Carolina Stark: Court ordered the Judgment of Conviction in Count 2 entered on July 17, 2014, and the sentence imposed on January 16, 2015, shall be vacated forthwith. It is also ordered that the charges in Counts 1 and 2 of the information, including the penalty enhancer in Count 2 for a second or subsequent offense, shall be reinstated.***
*5/8/2018  Sentence credit amended to 1,142 days.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Guzman

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (920) 426-5601, and mailed to:  Drug Abuse Correctional Center, Attn: Stephanie, PO Box 36, Winnebago, WI  54985-0036.  jm

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS, with credit for 818 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" after serving 4 YEARS of initial confinement.   

Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Letter from Associated Services, Inc.

Case in court for oral ruling re: defendants motion to vacate plea. Court places findings on the record. For reasons as set forth, the Court DENIES motion. Case set for sentencing in Branch 35. Court order remand pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Michael Guzman not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for oral ruling today.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Court orders case adjourned.  Oral ruling scheduled for January 10, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Motion hearing continued. Still sworn under oath for the state: Kerri Cleghorn. Court placed update as to Attorney Kerri Cleghorn's appearance needed in another court on the record. Court took judicial notice of transcripts from Honorable Judge Dimotto in the court file and CCAP records- per state's request. Defense counsel has no objections. Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court ordered case adjourned for Oral Decision, Branch 35. COURT RETAINED COURT FILE. Oral ruling scheduled for January 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in Court on defense motion to withdraw plea.  Motion hearing held.  Sworn for defense: defendant.  Court takes brief break to allow counsel time to speak with potential witness.  Case continues on the record.  Also present in court: Attorney Kerri Cleghorn.  Court holds colloquy with defendant.  Court places findings on the record.  Court finds defendant is waiving attorney/client privilege.  Sworn for the State: Attorney Kerri Cleghorn.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Attorney Kulkoski has just been appointed. If the defense is planning on filing a motion to withdraw guilty pleas, the defense should file the motion no later than 08/25/2017 by 01:30 pm. If a motion to withdraw pleas is filed, the Court will set a date for the State to respond and the sentencing will not take place at the next court date. If the defendant does not wish to withdraw his pleas, the sentencing shall proceed at the next scheduled court date. Parties are advised effective July 31, 2017, this case will be assigned to Branch 35, Judge Frederick Rosa. Case calendared for sentencing hearing on 08/25/2017 at 01:30 pm, Branch 35.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
The defendant informs the Court he would like to withdraw his guilty plea. Discussions placed on the record. By oral motion, Attorney Cleghorn moves to withdraw as Counsel of record. For reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion to withdraw. The Court will not make a ruling today as to the motion to withdraw guilty plea. Case adjourned for status of counsel on 07/11/2017 at 08:30 am, Branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ALL COUNTS REVERT BACK TO HOW THEY WERE ORIGINALLY CHARGED ON 4/3/2014.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 dismissed.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 06/27/2017 at 01:30, branch 17.

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn. Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
JUDGE JEAN DI MOTTO FOR BRANCH 17, JUDGE CAROLINA STARK.
The defendant by his Attorney informs the Court that he has obtained private counsel, and requests adjournment of jury trial. Court held colloquy with the defendant. The defendant has not paid a retainer fee to any attorney. There has been no formal retainer signed nor has anything been filed with the Court. For reasons placed on the record the Court DENIED defense request for adjournment of jury trial and for new counsel. The defendant informs the Court he would like to represent himself. Sworn: Michael Guzman, defendant. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding pro-se representation. For reasons placed on the record, the Court DENIED defense request to represent himself. In chambers discussion held. In chambers discussion placed on the record. The Court makes new finding that the defendant may represent himself for Jury trial today. The defendant requests adjournment to obtain standby counsel. The Court DENIED request for adjournment. The defendant indicates that he would like to pass the case to discussion his options with his attorney. Case passed. Case recalled. Same appearances. Case proceeded to plea hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Decision and Order, Granting Defense Motion to Withdraw Guilty Plea, received, signed and filed. tk
Copies mailed to parties and Stanley Institution.
Therefore, it is hereby ordered that the Defendant's motion to withdraw the guilty plea in Count 2 is granted. The Judgment of Conviction in Count 2 entered on July 17, 2014, and the sentence imposed on January 16, 2015, shall be vacated forthwith. It is also ordered that the charges in Counts 1 and 2 of the information, including the penalty enhancer in Count 2 for a second or subsequent offense, shall be reinstated. It is also ordered the cash bail of $5,000.00 (five thousand) and all of the condition of release from custody under 939 of the Wisconsin Statues that we in effect on July 17, 2014 shall be reinstated forthwith. It is also ordered that the parties shall contact Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge Carolina Maria Stark's clerk at 414-278-4500 as soon as possible to schedule the next hearing in Branch 17.
The correct telephone contact for postconviction counsel is (608) 890-3540.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin and Mitchell Kreiter.  Defendant Michael Guzman in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 15 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 133 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 8 years of initial confinement.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any cash bail to apply and any remaining balance is to be returned to the remitter. Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to participate in at least 1 Alcohol and Other Drug Abuse or sobriety support meeting.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons; including ammunition, holster or case. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering, distribution or manufacturing.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
- Defendant to not contact or associate with any member of a gang
- Defendant to not contact or associate with any known illegal drug user. 
- No contact with any place where illegal drugs purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
- Obtain/Maintain full time work and/or school.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Defendant Michael Guzman in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin and Mithcell Kreiter (appearance held in abeyance).  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).    
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED.  As to COUNT 2:  On motion of the state, court ordered the 'Second or Subsequent Offense' penalty enhancer stricken from the charge.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  PSI ordered.
